h3.a: Middle School Student Participates in Virtual Meeting with Dell Technologies

div.p: Eastern Middle School student, Madeline Lukaart, was a panelist on a Dell Technologies webinar about the current state of remote learning. Dell Technologies wanted to hear from students about their experiences and learn from them about how companies such as Dell can improve from a student’s perspective. Thank you to this EMS student for sharing […]

h3.a: FHE Newspaper Editor Has Zoom Meeting, Interview with Governor Whitmer

div.p: Hawk Herald of Forest Hills Eastern editor-in-chief, Isabel Gil, recently interviewed Governor Whitmer via Zoom. Beyond our pride in her work, she demonstrated professionalism, compassion, and represented FHPS in the most polished manner. Gil then wrote about her interview discussing health, havoc, and hope. To read the complete story, go to the Hawk Herald’s website linked […]

h3.a: FHPS Alumni Featured on WOOD Radio

div.p: West Michigan’s Morning News on WOOD Radio gave a shout out to Forest Hills Public Schools. WOOD Radio routinely produces shout outs featuring three different high schools. Today was FHPS and they highlighted three FHPS alumni. Take a listen.

h3.a: Free Ebooks, Audiobooks Available on FHPS Media Site

div.p: The digital library through FHPS is always open. Forest Hills subscribes to Overdrive for ebooks and audiobooks. Visit media.fhps.net to begin browsing our virtual shelves. Students can log in using your Forest Hills computer network username and password. Student Overdrive accounts are directly linked to grade level, so students have access to Juvenile, Teen, or All Materials, based upon […]

h3.a: Orchard View Teachers Have Article Featured in Environmental Education Publication

div.p: Orchard View Elementary School teachers, Anne Keller and Betsy Mast, wrote an article for the Michigan Alliance for Environmental and Outdoor Education that was published in their most recent publication, the April 2020 edition of the MAEOEgram. Our article is titled “Connecting Kids to Nature through Stewardship and Citizen Science.” It is located on page […]

h3.a: COVID-19 Update: Mental Health and Well-Being Support Web Page Added

div.p: Our world has changed significantly due to COVID-19. Everyone’s reality at home is now different. As a result, now more than ever, it is critical to take care of your mental health. Please remember that you are not alone; there are people in your school community to help. FHPS has created a web page full […]
